Welcome to the dark ages - The Kerbal Catapult contest.

Using all your cunning, ingenuity and whatever you can find lying by the road, construct a device which can launch a payload which is held in a "cup" on the end of a long arm. To keep a level playing field the payload has been selected for you, one that can't be tampered with; A Kerbal!!

The aim is to achieve the greatest horizontal distance. You can use what ever parts except for custom home made parts. The Kerbal must be thrown by the movement of the arm, not directly propelled by rockets. However using rockets to move the arm is definitely allowed.

Here is one I did as proof of concept, it has a max range of 363.4m

There is a vid of it too

There are several categories for the challenge.

Beginner:

Catapult can be secured to the ground using launch clamps.

Intermediate:

Catapult must be free standing/moveable.

Advanced:

Catapult must be moved and aimed so that the payload hits one of the buildings at the space centre (while still attempting to achieve greatest distance).

The 4th category can be combined with any of the other three;

MedievalGenius;

The catapult fires using only potential energy, no rockets/thrusters/(things that would scare medieval folk).

The range is the value shown on screen of the distance to the catapult when viewed from the payload. If you bounce then the distance taken is first contact with the ground after launch. To enter you need to submit a video from launch to landing (I think it would be easy to cheat otherwise).

There are also some optional achievements:

1) Catapult (excluding launch arm) remains intack after launch

2) Catapult can fire twice or fire 'double barrel'

3) Catapult can be reloaded and fire a second time (with same launch arm).

4) Semi-automatic Catapult. Can be reloaded several times from a 'magazine' (can use any payload for this)

And some milestones to try and defeat (apologies if all are impossible);

1st milestone is to manage to throw a Kerbal down the entire length of the runway.

2nd milestone is to (from same start point) get a Kerbal out to sea.

3rd (probably impossible) milestone is to throw your Kerbal to the next continent.

4th (just plain stupid, but we must not forget the space race) Catapult a Kerbal into orbit.

(this is the first challenge I've done, if you think I should do something differently then holla at me)

(I originally thought I was doing a Trebuchet contest. I now stand corrected, this is a catapult contest, but Trebuchets can enter)

This thread is one and half years old. Please do not necro. You may create your own challenge on the same topic if you wish.
Well, it only counts as necro if he's just saying something like "+1" or "I disagree". In this case, he's actually adding useful content, so there's no reason to lock the thread.

Necroing is "action to dig up a dead thread in a forum", regardless of what content are you adding.

Is the content he added useful? I guess not. It is related to different game than the original post was, to a game which is year and half newer.

Given how old this particular challenge is, it's probably better just to start a new thread with guidelines updated to take into account the changes that have been made to the game since then. I'll be locking this one up.
